text: Does anyone have any recommendations for tools for managing issues/notifications on GitHub?

elements.text: Does anyone have any recommendations for tools for managing issues/notifications on GitHub?

text: What do you mean by "manage"? I just get email notifications, that's it

elements.text: What do you mean by "manage"? I just get email notifications, that's it

text: <@UDB26738Q> - managing = triage, prioritization queues, deadlines, that sort of thing. What I have generally been doing is using todo.txt for writing todos and then prioritizing them from there. Was wondering if there was a more dedicated hub that I could use for this.

elements.text: - managing = triage, prioritization queues, deadlines, that sort of thing. What I have generally been doing is using todo.txt for writing todos and then prioritizing them from there. Was wondering if there was a more dedicated hub that I could use for this.

text: But perhaps my simpler approach is best. Just was curious if folks had any suggestions. :slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text: But perhaps my simpler approach is best. Just was curious if folks had any suggestions.

text: My solution is to keep the prs or issues that I am closely following in an open tab.

elements.text: My solution is to keep the prs or issues that I am closely following in an open tab.

text: Is there an app that can do iOS notifications?  The GitHub iOS app doesn’t seem to have actual notifications, just a “notifications” page you can visit and refresh

elements.text: Is there an app that can do iOS notifications?  The GitHub iOS app doesn’t seem to have actual notifications, just a “notifications” page you can visit and refresh
